newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers up, trade limited to essential buying.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers up, trade limited to essential buying.

text.p: ARA fuel oil bunker prices firmed on Wednesday as barges strengthened again and sellers had to settle for a small enquiries and fixtures.

Rotterdam 380 CST fuel oil was up another $1 to $100/$102 fob. Fuel oil barges hit a high of $100 in early trading. Dealers said there were a number of bunker enquiries, but the volume of each was small. Large buyers were discouraged by prevailing high prices, they said.
"The enquiries are of insubstantial volumes. I think the biggies are postponing their purchases for as long as possible," one dealer said.
Hamburg bunkers were steady and the market suffered from the same thinness of activity as Rotterdam.

In the Mediterranean, bunker prices were up on average $2 a tonne. As in the north, enquiries were numerous, but did not lead to substantial business. Dealers said gas oil and diesel buyers expected price falls on Thursday after futures losses.
Durban prices remained firm with slight talk of prompt shortages. Dealers said supply should increase by late August.
